creator: Warre, Henry James (Sir), 1819-1898. (author)
description: Warre, Henry James (Sir): 1819-1898. While a member of the British regular army stationed in Canada, sent on a mission to Oregon, 1845-1846 (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Warre, accompanied by Lieutenant Mervin Vavasour and Peter Skene Ogden, crossed the continent via the North Saskatchewan River in 1845 and returned in 1846. A few of the sketches are of the prairie region. Also published, with an introduction by Archibald Hanna, Jr., in an edition of 1,950 copies, Barre, Mass: Imprint Society, 1970 (26p., 72 leaves of plates).
format: [2], 1 leaf, 5 p., 16 leaves of plates, map.; 53.5 cm.
subject: Explorers, Surveyors and Travellers--Overland Journeys to the Pacific
